topic.title: Adding a Podcast Episode
topic.p: You can use this feature to add podcast episodes to a podcast channel.

ol.title: To add a podcast episode:

li.p: In the Global Tools menu group, click Podcast (expand the menu group to see the links, if necessary). For more information about expanding and collapsing menu groups, see Menus and Navigation.

ol.li: Click add content for the channel to which you would like to add the episode. The Add Podcast Episode to: window appears.

li.p: Enter the information about the episode in appropriate fields. The input information will be shown in podcasting aggregators that subscribe to the podcast channel. The asterisk (*) denotes required fields which must be completed.
Caution: The following characters cannot be used: ~ ! @ # $ % ^ * / \ ( ) ? . , &

ul.title: The following explains each field:
ul.li: Title of Episode: The name of the podcast episode (for example: John's Music).

Episode File URL: If you know the full URL for the podcast episode file, enter the URL in the Episode File URL: text field (for example: http://www.your_domain/mypodcast/myfile.mp3) and continue with the Description: information field. Otherwise, refer to Add/Edit for further assistance.

li.p: Add/Edit Clicking this link displays the Choose Episode to Add to Channel window. Use this link if you do not know the episode URL on the server, or to upload episode files or images to your Web directory, (for example: www/htdocs/mypodcast.)

Note: If available, clicking .. from the Contents of: Change Directory drop-down list, allows you to navigate to the parent directory of the current directory in the Web server and refreshes the Choose Episode to Add to Channel window to display the parent directory.

From the Choose Episode to Add to Channel window you can: select a file from the current directory to use as a podcast episode, select a file from another directory to use as a podcast episode, or upload a file or image to use for an episode from you local PC to the Web directory.

ol.title: To select an episode file from the current directory for a podcast episode:
ol.li: Click the Add/Edit link. The Choose Episode to Add to Channel window appears.

Click the select link from the Actions column for the file you want to add to your podcast channel as an episode. The Add Content window appears. The Episode File URL text field is populated with the episode URL.
Continue with the Description: information field.

ol.title: To select an episode file from another directory for a podcast episode:
ol.li: Click the Add/Edit link. The Choose Episode to Add to Channel window appears.
Select the directory from the Contents of: Change Directory drop-down list. The Choose Episode to Add to Channel window refreshes, displaying the directory you selected and a list of files.

Click the select link from the Actions column for the file you want to add to your podcast channel as an episode. The Add Content window appears. The Episode File URL text field is populated with the episode URL.
Continue with the Description: information field.

ol.title: Upload a podcast episode file or image from you local PC to the Web directory:
ol.li: For information about uploading your podcast episodes or images, go to Uploading Files.
Continue with the Description: information field.

ul.li: Description: The description for the podcast episode (for example: A look at my music).
Content Author: The name of the podcast episode author (for example: webmaaster@example.com).

li.p: Publication Date: The date the podcast episode was released. You can set the publication date to a future date. The podcast channel and podcast episode dates will be displayed to the channel subscribers. Select the Publication Date from the drop-down lists: Day:, Date:, Month:, Year:, Time: (Hour, Minute, and Second), and Time Zone:, (for example: Sat, 07 Nov 2005 00:00:01 GMT)

ul.li: iTunes Information: The iTunes Information section is an optional part of the podcasting process. This information is necessary only for the users who want to register their podcast channels on the iTunes Directory for Podcasts. If you want to register your podcast episodes on the iTunes Directory, go to iTunes Podcast Episode Information Fields. If you do not wish to complete this section, continue with Step 4.

li.p: Click Save. The Podcast window appears with a message informing you that your content has been added. The new podcast episode appears in the Episode Title of the channel.

To save this episode and create another, click Save/Add Another. The Add Podcast Episode to: window refreshes with a message informing you that the new podcast episode has been added. Repeat Steps 3 and 4 to add another episode.
Note: Clicking Cancel clears all the fields of the Add Podcast to: window and the Podcast window appears.
